title: Fatboy Slim remixes Greta Thunberg's speech for Right Here Right Now
text:
Greta gets the Fatboy Slim treatment

After showcasing his rather epic remix of Greta Thunberg’s iconic climate change speech on Twitter, Fatboy Slim has finally played the tune live.

Just a shame the teenage activist is still being mocked amid the celebration.

Last week the DJ took to social media to share a mashup someone else had made of the 16-year-old activist calling for change ‘right here, right now’.

With the backing of his 1998 banger Right Here, Right now, it all just came together and now the producer – real name Norman Cook – has taken the tune to his live show, with the crowd going wild for the pairing.

Frankly, how did we not think of this collaboration before?

It has been brought to my attention that @FatboySlim has mixed @GretaThunberg’s speech into “right here, right now” and it’s incredible pic.twitter.com/16ZoVCG1Y7 — Matthew (@TorbsTalks) October 6, 2019

One punter took to social media as they shared a clip filmed from the crowd.

‘It has been brought to my attention that @FatboySlim has mixed @GretaThunberg’s speech into “right here, right now” and it’s incredible,’ they wrote.

Late last month the Swedish campaigner blasted delegates at the United Nations conference for not doing enough to protect the environment.

‘You have stolen my dreams and my childhood with your empty words,’ she said, with various parts of her speech being sampled in Fatboy Slim’s track.

‘This is all wrong. I shouldn’t be up here,’ she said. ‘I should be back in school on the other side of the ocean. Yet you have come to us young people for hope. How dare you.

‘And yet I’m one of the lucky ones.

‘People are suffering. People are dying. Entire ecosystems are collapsing.

‘We are in the beginning of a mass extinction. And all you can talk about is money and fairytales of eternal economic growth. How dare you.’

Norman’s awesome nod comes as people continue to mock the young activist, though.

Only this morning Piers Morgan took aim at Greta, this time mocking the climate change activist while slamming the Extinction Rebellion protestors for eating McDonald’s.

After being challenged by Susanna Reid, Piers claimed he’s ‘doing a lot’ for climate change but his co-host celebrated Greta and the protestors for raising awareness about the issue.

That prompted Piers to launch into a ruthless impersonation of Greta, crying out: ‘How dare you? You stole my airtime.’
